philosophy.long: Morale represents fear, hesitation, and survival overriding orders. Coffin Canyon is not a game of fearless soldiers; it is a game of beings pushed too far.
philosophy.design_intent: Morale creates momentum; fear punishes overextension. Retreat is a valid tactic. Standing firm is not always the goal.

the_morale_test.short: Roll Quality dice; 4+ holds, 0 successes fails.
the_morale_test.trigger: Tested when triggered by destruction, Tainted terrain, sudden losses, fear-based abilities, or isolation.
the_morale_test.resolution: Roll d6s equal to current Quality. Each 4+ is a Success.

outcomes.failure: 0 Successes: The model fails. Resolve Shaken or Panicked as dictated by the rule.

shaken.definition: Hesitation, fear, or loss of footing.
penalties: Cannot take specific actions listed on unit card
shaken.recovery: Automatically removed at end of next activation, or via rally abilities.

panicked.immediate_effect: Move away from source of fear immediately. If movement is impossible, become Shaken instead.
panicked.activation_penalty: Lose 1 Action on next activation and -1 die on all rolls.
panicked.recovery: Requires distance, time, or specific abilities.

cascading_fear.logic: When a model is destroyed or panics, nearby Grunts or low-Quality models must test Morale.

monster_logic.logic: Monsters may ignore Morale, gain bonuses from enemy fear, or grow more dangerous as fear spreads. See Unit Card.
